intro: Tylostigma tenellum, commonly known as the slender sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the cooler months. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, adapted to store water in its native environment. Tylostigma tenellum is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is well-suited to drought conditions.
